summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to S. Shakir, commanding their appearance and production of all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena is dated August 15, 2019, and requires appearance on August 20, 2019, as part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction statutes.

persons.name: S. Shakir
persons.context: Individual commanded to appear before the grand jury and produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands all materials relating to him as part of a grand jury investigation into alleged federal violations.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Shakir is subpoenaed to produce all materials in their possession relating to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating they are a person of interest in the investigation concerning Epstein.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, issued the grand jury subpoena commanding Shakir's appearance and document production.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance of S. Shakir
events.description: S. Shakir is commanded to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square to testify and give evidence.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The subpoena is issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, initiating a formal demand for testimony and documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to S. Shakir on August 15, 2019, requiring their appearance on August 20, 2019.
The subpoena demands the production of all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including texts, emails, social media, documents, and notes.
The investigation involves alleged violations of federal statutes: 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (obstruction).
The subpoena explicitly states it covers materials stored electronically anywhere, including in foreign jurisdictions.
The document is signed by Geoffrey S. Berman, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
